channel.title: IPv6 on Prasenjit Manna
channel.description: Recent content in IPv6 on Prasenjit Manna

item.title: IPv6 Deployment
item.description: Over last 10 years, IPv6 standards have evolved significantly. It is important to understand the current status of these standards, as ongoing evolution—driven by various real-world deployments—has rendered some earlier standards obsolete. The following documents provide an overview of IPv6 and its current standardization status. Primer - A collaborative IPv6 book by Nick Buraglio and Brian E. Carpenter, Book Copy in PDF, github Deployment Guide Inessential IPv6. A primer for those with a technical background (Updated July 2023), Service Provider Background The JANET technical guide to IPv6 (April 2021) The APNIC IPv6 Fundamentals Course The RIPE NCC Advanced IPv6 training course.

item.title: Books
item.description: Programming Books Skiena; The Algorithm Design Manual The longer, more comprehensive, more practical. It’s similar in that it attempts to teach you how to identify problems, use the correct algorithm, and give a clear explanation of the algorithm. This also describess the real world programming. McDowell; Cracking the Coding Interview Some problems and solutions, with explanations, matching the level of questions you see in entry-level interviews at Google, Facebook, Microsoft, etc.
